'''Super OS''' (formerly: Super Ubuntu<ref>http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/</ref>) is a [[Linux]]-based [[operating system]]. It is a [[Software remastering|remastered]] version of [[Ubuntu]]<ref>http://linux.softpedia.com/progDownload/Super-OS-Download-44128.html</ref>made with [[reconstructor]]<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/su Super Ubuntu]</ref>. Its main goal is to provide an âOut of the Boxâ experience<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Super_Ubuntu_FAQ Super Ubuntu FAQ]</ref>, containing various enhancements over Ubuntu.
'''Super OS''' (formerly: Super Ubuntu<ref>http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/</ref>) is a [[Linux]]-based [[operating system]]. It is a [[Software remastering|remastered]] version of [[Ubuntu]]<ref>http://linux.softpedia.com/progDownload/Super-OS-Download-44128.html</ref>made with [[reconstructor]]<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/su Super Ubuntu]</ref>. Its main goal is to provide an âOut of the Boxâ experience<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Super_Ubuntu_FAQ Super Ubuntu FAQ]</ref>, containing various enhancements over Ubuntu.
â
==Features==
+
== Features ==
*First Linux distro to include an easy way to run executable files and scripts (with [[App Runner]])<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Notable_features_of_Super_OS</ref>
*First Linux distro to include an easy way to run executable files and scripts (with [[App Runner]])<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Notable_features_of_Super_OS</ref>
*'''Multimedia support''': ''Super OS'' is prepackaged with support for MP3 files and [[DVD-Video|video-DVDs]] by default, it also includes additional codecs, and [[VLC media player]]
*'''Multimedia support''': ''Super OS'' is prepackaged with support for MP3 files and [[DVD-Video|video-DVDs]] by default, it also includes additional codecs, and [[VLC media player]]
Line 34: Line 34:
*'''Additional software''': It also includes, [[Wine (software)|Wine]], the [[GUI for Uncomplicated Firewall]], and other software.
*'''Additional software''': It also includes, [[Wine (software)|Wine]], the [[GUI for Uncomplicated Firewall]], and other software.
â
==App Runner==
+
== App Runner ==
[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/App_Runner App Runner] is a script included in ''Super OS'' that allows any kind of executable or script to be launched without having to use the command line.<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/App_Runner</ref>. [[App Runner]] was also subject of an article by Lifehacker, saying "''App Runner would come in handy''" and "''there's plenty of scripts and closed-source apps that this would be useful for''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5224675/app-runner-makes-launching-linux-executables-easier</ref>.
[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/App_Runner App Runner] is a script included in ''Super OS'' that allows any kind of executable or script to be launched without having to use the command line.<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/App_Runner</ref>. [[App Runner]] was also subject of an article by Lifehacker, saying "''App Runner would come in handy''" and "''there's plenty of scripts and closed-source apps that this would be useful for''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5224675/app-runner-makes-launching-linux-executables-easier</ref>.
â
==Live USB==
+
== Live USB ==
There is also a Windows tool called [http://hacktolive.org/cd2usb cd2usb] to create [[Ubuntu]] and ''Super OS'' [[Live USB]]s. The program is already included in the DVD of Super OS<ref>http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/</ref>.
There is also a Windows tool called [http://hacktolive.org/cd2usb cd2usb] to create [[Ubuntu]] and ''Super OS'' [[Live USB]]s. The program is already included in the DVD of Super OS<ref>http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/</ref>.
â
==Reception and adoption==
+
== Reception and adoption ==
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [...] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml</ref>. ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu</ref>. ''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the [http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about Helios project] (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org]</ref><ref>[http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)]</ref>
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [...] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml</ref>. ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu</ref>. ''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the [http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about Helios project] (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org]</ref><ref>[http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)]</ref>
â
==Future development==
+
== Future development ==
{{beta software|section}}
{{beta software|section}}
The [http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ RUNZ framework], described as a pseudo-new way to install and run software on Linux<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ RUNZ at hacktolive.org]</ref>, allowing the use of [[Portable Apps]], super-deb installers, among other possible uses, is planned to be included in the next version of Super OS<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ</ref>. [http://hacktolive.org/wiki/File_mounter File Mounter] is also planned for ''Super OS'' 9.04 ''Service Pack'' 1<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/File_mounter File Mounter at hacktolive.org]</ref>.
The [http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ RUNZ framework], described as a pseudo-new way to install and run software on Linux<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ RUNZ at hacktolive.org]</ref>, allowing the use of [[Portable Apps]], super-deb installers, among other possible uses, is planned to be included in the next version of Super OS<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/RUNZ</ref>. [http://hacktolive.org/wiki/File_mounter File Mounter] is also planned for ''Super OS'' 9.04 ''Service Pack'' 1<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/File_mounter File Mounter at hacktolive.org]</ref>.
â
